apiGuide.title: Google API Key & Client ID Guide
apiGuide.intro: To use Google Drive sync, you need to get an API Key and OAuth 2.0 Client ID from Google Cloud and enter them in the settings. It may seem complex, but you can do it by following these steps.
apiGuide.step1Title: Step 1: Go to Google Cloud Console & Create a Project
step1: Go to Google Cloud Console and sign in.
Click the project dropdown at the top left, and select 'NEW PROJECT'.
Enter a project name like 'Heaven's Scribe' and click 'CREATE'.
apiGuide.step2Title: Step 2: Enable the Google Drive API
step2: Make sure your new project is selected.
In the left navigation menu, go to 'APIs & Services' > 'Library'.
Search for 'Google Drive API' and select it.
step3: In the left menu, go to 'APIs & Services' > 'Credentials'.
Click '+ CREATE CREDENTIALS' at the top and select 'API key'.
Copy your new API key and paste it into the 'API Key' field in the app's settings. Do not close this window yet.
For security, click on the API key you just created in the list to edit it.
In the 'Website restrictions' section, click '+ ADD AN ITEM' and enter the following value, then click 'DONE':
apiGuide.step4Title: Step 4: Create an OAuth 2.0 Client ID
apiGuide.step4_1: First, you need to configure the OAuth consent screen. Go to 'OAuth consent screen' in the left menu.
step4_3_list: App name: Heaven's scribe (or any name you prefer)
User support email: Select your email address

apiGuide.step4_5: On the 'Scopes' step, don't add anything and click 'SAVE AND CONTINUE'.
apiGuide.step4_6: On the 'Test users' step, click '+ ADD USERS' and add your own Google account email. Then click 'ADD' and 'SAVE AND CONTINUE'.
apiGuide.step4_7: Review the summary and click 'BACK TO DASHBOARD'.
apiGuide.step4_8: Now, create the Client ID. Go back to 'Credentials' in the left menu.

userGuide.title: Heaven's Scribe User Guide
userGuide.welcome: Welcome to Heaven's Scribe! This app helps you efficiently manage materials for sermon preparation.
userGuide.coreConceptBody: This app is designed around using an Excel file as the source of truth for your data. All your materials are safely stored in an Excel file on your computer, and the app acts as a tool to edit this file.
userGuide.workflowSteps: ‚ë† Import ‚Üí ‚ë° Work in App ‚Üí ‚ë¢ Save (Export as a new file)
userGuide.step1Body: Click the 'Import All Data' button in the header to load an Excel file matching the template format. All content from the file will be loaded into the app.
userGuide.step1Note: * If you're a first-time user, first go to [Settings] > [Data Management] to 'Download Template File'.
userGuide.step2Body: Freely add, edit, and delete materials in the Keyword, Bible, and Sermon modes. All changes are temporarily saved in your browser.
userGuide.step3Body: When you make changes, the red 'Save' button in the header becomes active. Click this button (or use the shortcut Ctrl+S) to download a new Excel file containing all your current data.
userGuide.step3Note: ‚Äª Important: This does not modify your original file. A new file with a timestamp in its name is created, which helps with version control.
userGuide.featureGlobalSearch: Global Search: Use the search bar at the top to search through all content across Keywords, Bible, and Sermons at once.
userGuide.featureDoubleClick: Quick Edit: In any mode, double-click an item to open the edit window immediately.
userGuide.featureKeywordMode: Keyword Mode: Organize materials by topic. Add/select keywords in the left list and manage related book quotes or notes on the right. Use the search bar above the keyword list to quickly find a specific keyword or content within it.
userGuide.featureBibleMode: Bible Mode: Organize materials by scripture. Select a book from the left list, and on the right, add commentary or references for specific verses. In the 'Add New Material' section, enter a reference like 1:15-17 to add material to that location.
userGuide.featureSermonMode: Sermon Mode: Manage your own sermons or reference sermons from others. You can filter sermons by book in the left list.
userGuide.featureHwpConvert: HWP Data Conversion (AI Feature): Automatically convert text copied from word processors like HWP into the app's data format. Select the material type (Keyword, Bible, Sermon) and paste the content. You can preview and edit the results before adding them to the app or downloading them as a separate Excel file. (This feature must be enabled in settings, requires a Gemini API Key, and may incur costs based on usage.)
userGuide.featureGdriveSync: Google Drive Sync: This is a separate feature from Excel file management. It allows you to back up your data to Google Drive in real-time and sync across multiple devices. You can continue your work on another computer or browser without manually transferring Excel files.
userGuide.featureGdriveSyncNote: * This feature syncs the app's internal data with Google Drive, not the Excel file itself. It requires registering a Google API Key and Client ID in the settings menu.
userGuide.settingsDisplay: Display: Adjust the global font size or display book names as abbreviations in Bible mode.
userGuide.settingsSecurity: Security: Set a PIN to lock the app on startup.
userGuide.settingsApi: API Settings: Manage API keys required for Google Drive Sync and HWP Conversion (Gemini).
